verses.text: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, \add Even\add* a lamentation, O house of Israel.
The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: She is forsaken upon her land; \add there is\add* none to raise her up.
For thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; The city that went out \add by\add* a thousand shall leave an hundred, And that which went forth \add by\add* an hundred shall leave ten, To the house of Israel.
For thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
But seek not Beth-el, nor enter \add into\add* Gilgal, And pass not \add to\add* Beer-sheba: For Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, And Beth-el shall come to nought.
Seek the \sc Lord\sc*, and ye shall live; Lest he break out like fire \add in\add* the house of Joseph, And devour \add it\add*, and \add there be\add* none to quench \add it\add* in Beth-el.
\add Ye\add* who turn judgment to wormwood, And leave off righteousness in the earth,

\add Seek him\add* that maketh the seven stars and Orion, And turneth the shadow of death into the morning, And maketh the day dark \add with\add* night: That calleth for the waters of the sea, And poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* his name:
That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, So that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.
They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, And they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

Forasmuch therefore as your treading \add is\add* upon the poor, And ye take from him burdens of wheat: Ye have built houses of hewn stone, But ye shall not dwell in them; Ye have planted pleasant vineyards, But ye shall not drink wine of them.
For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: They afflict the just, they take a bribe, And they turn aside the poor in the gate \add from their right\add*.
Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; For it \add is\add* an evil time.
Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: And so the \sc Lord\sc*, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: It may be that the \sc Lord\sc* God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore the \sc Lord\sc*, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing \add shall be\add* in all streets; And they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! And they shall call the husbandman to mourning, And such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
And in all vineyards \add shall be\add* wailing: For I will pass through thee, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Woe unto \add you\add* that desire the day of the \sc Lord\sc*! To what end \add is\add* it for you? The day of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* darkness, and not light.
As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; Or went \add into\add* the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
\add Shall\add* not the day of the \sc Lord\sc* \add be\add* darkness, and not light? Even very dark, and no brightness in it?
I hate, I despise your feast \add days\add*, And I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.
Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept \add them:\add* Neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; For I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
But let judgment run down as waters, And righteousness as a mighty stream.
Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, The star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, Saith the \sc Lord\sc*, whose name \add is\add* The God of hosts.
